1_1E4dgsD9i7VtW5ZEdGX6EbPewT1wrsczqY.body:
http://retroshare.net/ - Retroshare was founded by drbob in 2006, as a platform to provide "secure communications and file sharing with friends".

https://freenetproject.org/ - Browse websites, post on forums, and publish files within Freenet with strong privacy protections.

https://greycoder.com/best-vpn-service/ - best vpn service reviews.

https://psiphon.ca/index.html - "For 10 years, Psiphon has provided open access to the Internet to citizens of countries with information controls and limitations."

https://getlantern.org/index.html - "Better than a VPN"

Whonix](https://www.whonix.org/ - "Offers you the most secure way to surf the web."

> [tp](#comment_3_13famWF3y6uoaCw8pnQyqEYXyUyZ81sZuw): Palemoon's developer started blacklisting adblockers because it causes a "disruption to digital economy".https://forum.palemoon.org/viewtopic.php?f=46&t=16504 [...]

Brave hasn't started their ad program yet. But as long as I still have a choice I'm ok with it. I'm also ok with some ads, especially if I get a cut of the revenue.

I just started using AdNauseam in Vivaldi, I have ÂµBlock Origins installed in Edge, and I use Brave's internal blockers when using that.

It seems that Brave Mobile is the best mobile browser right now as long as you don't need some weird extension.

8_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY.body:
> [bluefool](#comment_17_1FhAYRUS5wgHGeZHtergg1rWU4diKnKuuU): how do I completely shut down my public online identity in an hour?

Stop using Google everything, save your contracts, then delete the accounts and purge all google software from your system. Export your Chrome bookmarks than purge that as well. Delete Facebook especially all the Facebook apps. What's App is also owned by Facebook.

If you must set up a LinkedIn profile for work. 

https://darkshroud24.wordpress.com/2017/07/16/alternatives-to-google-facebook-and-reclaiming-privacy/

> [kmueller](#comment_37_1PvReUtzc5s92BWTUDnxvmVGepNcyA2otB): You can also host a domain for cheap, they usually come with emails. Just make sure the server is not in the US or UK and the company isnt too.

Being outside the US will not stop the NSA in anyway. In fact the US recently had a pro-free speech Supreme Court ruling. You're safer in the US than in Canada, UK, or any EU country.

> [kmueller](#comment_34_1PvReUtzc5s92BWTUDnxvmVGepNcyA2otB): Alternatively, start using PGP and a real mail client like thunderbird (with the enigmail addon) instead of webmail. That way all your emails are kept encrypted on the server. This is not ideal, but better than nothing.

I use Outlook with https://www.gpg4win.org/ for PGP email signing and encrypting on my system.

For Thunderbird also check out TorBirdy: https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/wiki/torbirdy
